verses.verse: Ya`akov <WG2385>, a servant <WG1401> of 'Elohim <WG2316> and <WG2532> of the YY <WG2962> Yeshuw`a <WG2424> Moshiach <WG5547>, to the twelve <WG1427> tribes <WG5443> which <WG1722> are scattered abroad <WG1290>, greeting <WG5463> <WG5721>.

Knowing <WG1097> <WG5723> this, that <WG3754> the trying <WG1383> of your <WG5216> faith <WG4102> worketh <WG2716> <WG5736> patience <WG5281>.

<WG1161> If any <WG1536> of you <WG5216> lack <WG3007> <WG5743> wisdom <WG4678>, let him ask <WG154> <WG5720> of <WG3844> 'Elohim <WG2316>, that giveth <WG1325> <WG5723> to all <WG3956> men liberally <WG574>, and <WG2532> upbraideth <WG3679> <WG5723> not <WG3361>; and <WG2532> it shall be given <WG1325> <WG5701> him <WG846>.

But <WG1161> let him ask <WG154> <WG5720> in <WG1722> faith <WG4102>, nothing <WG3367> wavering <WG1252> <WG5734>. For <WG1063> he that wavereth <WG1252> <WG5734> is like <WG1503> <WG5758> a wave <WG2830> of the sea <WG2281> driven with the wind <WG416> <WG5746> and <WG2532> tossed <WG4494> <WG5746>.

A double minded <WG1374> man <WG435> is unstable <WG182> in <WG1722> all <WG3956> his <WG846> ways <WG3598>.
<WG1161> Let <WG2744> the brother <WG80> of low degree <WG5011> rejoice <WG2744> <WG5737> in <WG1722> that he <WG846> is exalted <WG5311>:
But <WG1161> the rich <WG4145>, in <WG1722> that he <WG846> is made low <WG5014>: because <WG3754> as <WG5613> the flower <WG438> of the grass <WG5528> he shall pass away <WG3928> <WG5695>.

For <WG1063> the sun <WG2246> is no sooner risen <WG393> <WG5656> with <WG4862> a burning heat <WG2742>, but <WG2532> it withereth <WG3583> <WG5656> the grass <WG5528>, and <WG2532> the flower <WG438> thereof <WG846> falleth <WG1601> <WG5627>, and <WG2532> the grace <WG2143> of the fashion <WG4383> of it <WG846> perisheth <WG622> <WG5639>: so <WG3779> also <WG2532> shall <WG3133> the rich man <WG4145> fade away <WG3133> <WG5701> in <WG1722> his <WG846> ways <WG4197>.

Blessed <WG3107> is the man <WG435> that <WG3739> endureth <WG5278> <WG5719> temptation <WG3986>: for <WG3754> when he is tried <WG1384> <WG1096> <WG5637>, he shall receive <WG2983> <WG5695> the crown <WG4735> of life <WG2222>, which <WG3739> the YY <WG2962> hath promised <WG1861> <WG5662> to them that love <WG25> <WG5723> him <WG846>.

Let <WG3004> no man <WG3367> say <WG3004> <WG5720> when he is tempted <WG3985> <WG5746>, <WG3754> I am tempted <WG3985> <WG5743> of <WG575> 'Elohim <WG2316>: for <WG1063> 'Elohim <WG2316> cannot be tempted <WG551> <WG2076> <WG5748> with evil <WG2556>, neither <WG1161> tempteth <WG3985> he <WG846> <WG3985> <WG5719> any man <WG3762>:
But <WG1161> every man <WG1538> is tempted <WG3985> <WG5743>, when he is drawn away <WG1828> <WG5746> of <WG5259> his own <WG2398> lust <WG1939>, and <WG2532> enticed <WG1185> <WG5746>.

Then <WG1534> when lust <WG1939> hath conceived <WG4815> <WG5631>, it bringeth forth <WG5088> <WG5719> sin <WG266>: and <WG1161> sin <WG266>, when it is finished <WG658> <WG5685>, bringeth forth <WG616> <WG5719> death <WG2288>.
Do <WG4105> not <WG3361> err <WG4105> <WG5744>, my <WG3450> beloved <WG27> brethren <WG80>.

Havahry <WG3956> good <WG18> gift <WG1394> and <WG2532> every <WG3956> perfect <WG5046> gift <WG1434> is <WG2076> <WG5748> from above <WG509>, and cometh down <WG2597> <WG5723> from <WG575> the Father <WG3962> of lights <WG5457>, with <WG3844> whom <WG3739> is <WG1762> <WG5748> no <WG3756> variableness <WG3883>, neither <WG2228> shadow <WG644> of turning <WG5157>.

But <WG1161> be ye <WG1096> <WG5737> doers <WG4163> of the word <WG3056>, and <WG2532> not <WG3361> hearers <WG202> only <WG3440>, deceiving <WG3884> <WG5740> your own selves <WG1438>.

For <WG1063> he beholdeth <WG2657> <WG5656> himself <WG1438>, and <WG2532> goeth his way <WG565> <WG5754>, and <WG2532> straightway <WG2112> forgetteth <WG1950> <WG5633> what manner of man <WG3697> he was <WG2258> <WG5713>.

But <WG1161> whoso looketh <WG3879> <WG5660> into <WG1519> the perfect <WG5046> Torah <WG3551> of liberty <WG1657>, and <WG2532> continueth <WG3887> <WG5660> therein, he <WG3778> being <WG1096> <WG5637> not <WG3756> a forgetful <WG1953> hearer <WG202>, but <WG235> a doer <WG4163> of the work <WG2041>, this man <WG3778> shall be <WG2071> <WG5704> blessed <WG3107> in <WG1722> his <WG846> deed <WG4162>.

If any man <WG1536> among <WG1722> you <WG5213> seem <WG1380> <WG5719> to be <WG1511> <WG5750> religious <WG2357>, and bridleth <WG5468> <WG5723> not <WG3361> his <WG846> tongue <WG1100>, but <WG235> deceiveth <WG538> <WG5723> his own <WG846> heart <WG2588>, this man's <WG5127> religion <WG2356> is vain <WG3152>.
